page.title: 20Cliff Erosion - Eastchurch
page.content: The{cliffs}along the north coast of Sheppey are constantly being eroded. The Royal Oak Public House went over the cliffs in the late 1960s. After this it was decided to try and make the cliffs safe so in part they were{landscaped}and huge stones were put at the bottom and pebble{drainage channels were laid. However this cost a great deal of money so the council will probably concentrate on the highly populated areas. The reason for the cliff{erosion}is the rain and wind which beats against them and the vast number of underground streams. The cliffs are of clay which soaks up the water in winter but this means that in summer they crack and fall down as they dry out.
